name: MetaanalysisEligibilityCriteria_Mean_difference_in_HbA1c_effect_of_bariatric_surgery_in_type_2_diabetes_and_elevated_BMI_in_2016_meta_analysis
title: MetaanalysisEligibilityCriteria: Mean difference in HbA1c effect of bariatric surgery in type 2 diabetes and elevated BMI in 2016 meta-analysis

extension.valueMarkdown: MetaanalysisEligibilityCriteria: Mean difference in HbA1c effect of bariatric surgery in type 2 diabetes and elevated BMI in 2016 meta-analysis [Database Entry: FHIR Group Resource]. description: Study population includes type 2 diabetes and BMI > 25 kg/m2; study design includes randomized assignment; exposure is bariatric surgery vs. no bariatric surgery; outcome measured is mean difference in HbA1c comparing bariatric surgery vs. no bariatric surgery

characteristic.description: Study population includes type 2 diabetes and BMI > 25 kg/m2

valueReference.display: StudyEligibilityCriteria: Type 2 diabetes and elevated BMI in 2016 meta-analysis

characteristic.description: exposure is bariatric surgery vs. no bariatric surgery

valueReference.display: GroupAssignment: Bariatric Surgery vs. no bariatric surgery

characteristic.description: outcome measured is mean difference in HbA1c comparing bariatric surgery vs. no bariatric surgery

valueReference.display: OutcomeVariable: Mean difference in HbA1c between Surgery and Medical/Lifestyle groups at end of follow-up
